div1.p: Jones inquires if Hench will contribute an article on the Cuban version of yellow fever history for the "Bulletin of the Medical Library Association."

div1.head: Letter from Harold W. Jones to Philip Showalter Hench, January 8, 1942
div1.opener:

DR. HAROLD W. JONES, Chairman
and Editor of the Bulletin
Army Medical Library
Washington, D. C.

Associate Editor
Army Medical Library
Washington, D. C.
MEDICAL
LIBRARY
ASSOCIATION
MISS L. MARGUERIETE PRIME
American College of Surgeons Library
Chicago, III.
MISS RUTH HARLAMERT
King County Medical Society Library
Seattle, Wash.
THOMAS E. KEYES
Mayo Clinic Library

Bulletin of the
MEDICAL LIBRARY ASSOCIATION
Office of the Editor
Army Medical Library
7th Street and Independence Ave., S. W.
Washington, D. C.
January 8, 1942.
FOUNDED 1902
I talked with Mr. Keys about this and he
thought it would be well for you to see Colonel
Jones if possible while you are in Washington.
Dr. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We have just had a letter from Mr. Keys of the Mayo
Clinic Library and he suggests that you might be able to con-
tribute a paper for the Bulletin of the Medical Library Associa-
tion on “The Cuban Version of the History of Yellow Fever.”
If you could submit this at an early date, I should be very
happy to consider publishing it not later than the July number.
We should have the copy for this number by May 1, 1942 in order
to make the arrangements, and if convenient, I should like to have
it sooner than that.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Col. Harold W. Jones
Editor ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO THE EDITOR
